comment.text: Storico Fresco never disappoints. A quiet afternoon lunch or an evening dining experience, the food is quality- rich with flavor and authenticity.The charcuterie boards are an excellent grazing conversational bite, perfect for a day date or girls' night out. The Caccio e pepe entree is served al dente with a rich cheese coating, a must try. And last but not least, for dessert, if you are a lover or evening liker of espresso, the Affgato (Espresso + Gelato) will blow you away. Our server was very attentive and accommodating.

The first thing you notice when you review the menu of Storia Fresco- is the QR code - which loads to a manifesto of sorts - from the owner - to the guests.....it's an interesting read, some I agree with, some, well - to each their own,   But the headline here is the pasta - it's real, and it's' fabulous.....more details - 

Storico Fresco is a HUGELY popular spot in Buckhead,  It is a market of sorts, acting as a restaurant.  Very casual, very busy, mixed crowd - singles, couples, groups, kids, dates.....noisy - hard to hear.  Outside patio is nice, sidewalk is not nice as the sewer smell is present.

We had a variety of food - ALL of it was superb.   The meat and cheese board, fantastic - good variety, bread service - fantastic,   Octopus, deeply grilled/charred - great flavor with nice beans, herbs.....super good.  

All of us had pasta, except one who had salmon.   The pasta is house made, and it is lovely, a nice bite.  The bolognese is perfect, the mushroom cream sauce is perfect.   The sizes are perfect - who complains about portion size?  I don't quite understand that.   It's a fine size - and the pasta and sauce are rich, filling and just right

The salmon was not good - overcooked.   Asked for a mista salad on the side, got a spinach salad

A number of times, the runner brought wrong food to the table.   No problem, we let them know it wasn't ours and he took it back, but the third time, he was clearly annoyed.   Also one of our table didn't get their food - and no - it didn't take longer - as the manifesto warns ahead of time, it was just forgotten.  

Overall, a pleasant experience.  Good lively atmosphere, good food, decent service- no not great service, but I don' think that is possible.  They pack the place, they don't have enough servers or kitchen staff.   I don't pretend that is still not a problem - it is.  But asking guests to have infinite patience isn't right either - I guess we vote with our feet and head somewhere else - OR - maybe the owner says - hmmm.  Maybe don't seat so many people that service suffers - OR - maybe seat people, give them some bread and a low cost glass of wine and say - glad you are here.   We will get to you as soon as we can service you well.    A statement doesn't excuse errors....it DOES give people context and that is a good thing, but it is not a cure-all....yes they make mistakes, as we all do. But they also make fabulous pasta.  

Go eyes wide open, be prepared for a really good meal, roll with the glitches, if something doesn't look right, then say something....and mangia!  Enjoy

Half price cocktails Tuesday. Hello. 
Half price bottles of wine Monday. Hello. 
Rosé Wednesday. Hello. 

Why aren't you eating here right now? 

I've been here a few times. It's lively, lovely, efficient, and delicious. Think your Italian Grandmom's kitchen but noisier and trendier. Market meets dining room. 

Squash blossoms filled with ricotta - swoon. 
Meatballs - like my Italian Grandmothers. Maybe better, but don't tell her. 

Negronis - definitely drink more than one.

photos.caption: Linguine al Pesto e Gamberi & Rapini

comment.text: Cute date night spot. I had their mista salad and shrimp linguine pasta. Both were delicious. Pasta is so much better when the pasta is made fresh. Their tiramisu dessert was great - fresh cream and not too sweet. They didn't have Malbec, my choice of red wine, but the server recommended something close and she did a good job.

We stopped by here awhile back at the recommendation of a friend who likes Italian. I made reservations for a weekday lunch. It was a little difficult for me to figure out where the location was because of apple maps once we walked down the street it was off to the side. 

We were quickly seated inside. The inside is trendy and loud. I can see where having a conversation can be hard. We had to pretty much yell to have a conversation. We ordered the Polpette, Tagliatelle alla Bolognese, and Chitarra Arrabbiata. The food was ok. The pasta was chewy which is good, but I think everything was too acidic for my liking. My husband also thought the food was ok too. Would I come back? Possibly, but not really worth a solo trip to the area.

I was thoroughly impressed by the quality of the food. From the meat and cheese board to the pane carasau salad and the cacio e pepe, everything was simply incredible. Each dish was bursting with flavor and clearly made with care and attention to detail.

The ambiance of the restaurant was also enjoyable, with great music that added to the overall experience. However, I must admit that when the restaurant gets busy, it can get quite loud, which can make it difficult to hold a conversation with the people at your table.

Despite this minor drawback, the service was good and our server was attentive and knowledgeable about the menu. Overall, I would highly recommend Storico Alimentari for anyone looking for a delicious meal in a lively atmosphere.

Trying Storico after awhile for a lunch. The restaurant was quite crowded during Monday lunch. The caccio de pepe and tagliatelle and the octopus are pretty decent. The only thing is they can only split check into 6 (equal amount)
Went here for an engagement celebration. The atmosphere was amazing. Great music and ambiance. Our waiter gave us a wonderful wine recommendation and all of the pastas were extremely fresh.

The parking at this place is not good. The street parking requires payment. And free parking at buckhead village which is a mess. We sat outside and it was great. The bread as an app was messy. They don't cut it all the way through. So we have to rip it. I got the rigatoni pesto. It was GREAT! Would highly recommend it. The server was nice. Though she forgot to bring more parm to the table. The reason this place gets a 4 is for the parking situation. Overall a great experience though
I was sold at fresh handmade pasta.  Tagliatelle bolognese was delicious!!  Affogatto & tiramisu for dessert was an extra bonus!

A true hidden gem! Beautiful eatery, inside and out. We went for lunch - the homemade pasta was perfectly cooked and delicious, the meatball panini was wonderfully seasoned, and the drink menu has something for everyone.

photos.caption: Polpette panini,  Cacio e Pepe, The Heather McMahan Spritz

comment.text: Came here for a celebratory lunch for my one year-old niece. SERVICE and Food were excellent. Sat outside on the patio underneath the walkway closest to the athletic store. Dined on a starter of fried branzino and calamari - very light and fresh seafood and the breading was light and delicate. Also have the fried artichoke hearts those were delicious as well and very light and fresh. Main dish was the Cacio e Pepe with a side of salmon *chef's kiss*. Do you have to be a big fan of black pepper to really like the Cacio a Pepe so keep that in mind. We also had some sparkling rose to wet our whistle along with sparkling water and Atlanta's finest. Perfect lunch, very refreshing and filling and walked away feeling very satiated.

photos.caption: Cacio e Pepe with a side of salmon

comment.text:
Unfortunately this will now be a to go only spot for me. We finally made it in for a dining experience and were left sorely disappointed. We started with the suppli siciliano risotto balls. In theory, they should have been amazing with mozzarella cheese and ragu inside but the filling was cold and the mozzarella wasn't melted. I also think it should most definitely be made known that you only get two balls for $14!!! The Instagram picture advertises more and it's not even like they are large portions.... I mean we are talking slightly larger than a golfball. I honestly feel robbed after this one and am still disappointed in myself for not saying something to the server. 

We then got the bolognese and cacio e pepe for our entrees. No one offered us cheese or pepper and we had to ask for the bread we had ordered at the beginning of the meal. The cacio e pepe was the real let down.. the flavor was there but the pasta simply wasn't cooked. We are all about an al dente pasta but this was not that and tough to chew. Beyond the food, club music was playing the whole meal making for a weird vibe. 

Honestly we walked away from this whole experience saying that there are much better Italian options in Atlanta, including their sister restaurant Forza Storico.

owner_replies.comment:
So sad you award us a 1 Star review but that’s your choice to punish a restaurant group that had to re invent itself during these tough times. Food is everything. We let you down. So sorry you had the worse experience of your life. Many others loved tonight because they are mindful of how incredibly hard it is for our industry to even stay afloat. 
We will keep your review in mind and try to do better but understand these are not normal times when half of the available population prefers to stay home and gather unemployment while we strive to do what we can. 
Be mindful. Everyone lost a LOT in the last 4 months. Glad to see you didn’t. 
Elite reviewers make the day. We bow out with a very simple sorry. And a very simple go wherever you want because we suck. We’re horrible. Everyone hates Storico. Let everyone know we are the worse Italian restaurant in Atlanta. Thank you Sarah. Good luck to you too

comment.text: We had heard a lot of great things about this place but left feeling a little underwhelmed. The apps were okay. The artichoke was supposed to be delicious but there wasn't much sustenance to it. The bread was good but light on olive oil. The atmosphere was lively but the music was uncomfortably loud for a date night. The entrees saved the day. I had the fried pork chop. It was juicy and had a savory citrus finish with the arugula on top. My wife ordered the cappelletti spinaci which had a very tasty center and has protein from the spinach. I'm particular about having protein in my meals. Many of the pastas came with no protein, so the spinaci is a good delicious and nutritious choice.

No longer vegan friendly and shockingly disrespectful. We used to visit this restaurant regularly and they always allowed the simple modification of removing the mozzarella from their veggie panini. Now, however, they aggressively refuse this modification - losing a loyal batch of customers along the way. 

Strongly recommend not dining at this restaurant if vegan or have dietary restrictions as they have made it clear they will not deviate from their set menu (in the most simple of ways) to allow customers to eat.

We made a last minute reservation for 2 on open table and were not disappointed! We were quickly seated outside (that was our preference). 

Parking: there is parking on the side of the street but you can also park in the shopping center right up the block after hours without fearing being towed (I actually checked with the hostess if it was ok to park there and she said yes).

Food: 
Squash blossoms - AMAZING!!! Highly recommend! Total of 4.
Cacio e pepe - yum!! hit the spot!
Ravioli spinaci - looked very yummy, good portion size too

Drinks:
Pinot Noir - not too shabby

Service:
It was a bit cold and windy so we asked if they can turn the heater on next to us which he did. The waiter was friendly and I accidentally left my jacket ther but went back when I realized and they were holding it for me.

The only minor thing that was a bit eh was that the outside tables were on the steep hill so it was a bit hard to sit the entire time. Overall, great experience with wonderful Italian food!

This place is a great place to eat dinner. They have terrific service, the menu is simple, and the staff are well knowledgeable in answering any questions you may have!

I had the lasagna & it was very good. The pasta was soft, and the sauce & meat was well seasoned and tasted very flavorful! The food came out very quickly also! The bread service was great also and tasted as if it was just freshly baked! I would highly recommend coming here if you are in the area.

The outdoor dining area was my favorite part as it was shaded, had adequate fans, and the ambience/vibe was very relaxed!

This place stays busy especially on the weekends. Definitely need a reservation and make sure to do it early. Only con is that when I do make a reservation, I always end up still having to wait. This wait was almost 20 minutes after my reservation. They do have out door seating in the patio. It is slightly enclosed and heaters make it quite toasty. I didn't sit outside but it did feel very warm even though it was quite frigid outside. Inside is very loud, so just be aware if you are expecting a quieter environment. The food is divine though. All pasta dishes are amazing! Definitely try there list of custom craft cocktails as well. My go to place for Italian!
Just wow  food was fabulous and atmosphere was fun, you may need to talk loudly to hear each other. Fun place.

user.name: Jennifer B.
user.address: Biltmore Acres, North Druid Hills, GA

comment.text:
I give Storico Fresco 4 stars for the food but 2 for the overall experience. Why? Went twice, once with 3 friends and last night with my husband. Nice choice of appetizers and pasta dishes, good quality, fair selection of wines and drinks BUT the place is extremely loud, the tables inside and out are very small, wobbly, and close to each other. Outside, the super tiny wooden tables for 2 and the chairs are literally ready to flip any moment also because on a downhill sidewalk. Now, not trying to be too picky but that's not exactly the type of comfort I am looking for when dining out. 
It's a restaurant, where you spend easy $60/80 per person, they really need to work on the furniture, set up, and service.

It was a Saturday night in Atlanta and I started to realize that not having reservations for our party of 8 was going to be a problem.  All of the places I called did not have any times available.  Somehow however I was able to snag a table online for Storico Fresco. 

I was so glad I did as when we showed up this place was absolutely SLAMMED.  Honestly i was in shock that they had our table waiting for us with no wait considering how busy it was here.

This is a very lively place, it's basically an italian market where you can also dine.  It's not very big but it is extremely popular and pretty loud inside.  We were actually having trouble hearing our waiter as it was so loud.

The pasta here is made in house and everything we got was absolutely delicious.  I had the Cavatelli with wild boar ragu and I enjoyed it very much.  

This ended up being a great place to bring a big party since it had a great ambiance and we had a very nice dinner.  I would definitely recommend this place but definitely get a reservation.

I went for dinner and ordered the Bertu.  It was delicious but the portions were ridiculously small. I'm not even sure if it would qualify as an appetizer. It was served in a tiny little bowl.  There were no garnishments on the plate and no color.  It just looked very plain and simple.  The restaurant also does not serve any bread which is unusual for an Italian restaurant. We were still starving at the end of our meal, and we were going to order more food, but we never saw our waitress again.  So we paid using the barcode on the table and our phone.  Then we went to another restaurant and ordered a second dinner.  It ended up being an expensive night.

Staying at a local hotel ordered some food via GrubHub from Storico. 

Saw many positive reviews regarding the squash blossoms so placed an order for the appetizer. They were very good. For $11, a bit on the pricey side.

For dinner I ordered the Salmone. The fish was cooked very well. The seasoning on top was one of the best I've had.

Along with the dinner and appetizer came a side salad which was nicely portioned and the dressing was very good.

Note to ownership; when someone orders via GrubHub and especially from a hotel it might be a wise idea to spend the extra $0.11 and include a fork and a napkin.

owner_replies.comment:
Hello Tim. 

Thank you for your awesome review. Mostly, sorry for the missing to-go silverware, it’s always a priority to make sure our takeout bags have everything in them. Apologies for the slip.

comment.text: Largely disappointed in the experience at Storico- ultimately the service is the biggest downfall, but the food didn't really help compensate. We had a reservation for 2 and got sat at the smallest patio table I've ever seen at a restaurant, right against the door of the neighboring gym. After ordering a side of cocktails and bread service, it took over 40 minutes for our server to ask for our main entree order. After ordering, the server did not stop by until we had already completed the dinner and were ready for the check (which I would expect more of considering we were spending over $100 for a meal). The food was mids for the price and the service was very disappointing.

Great service, excellent food and ambiance 
Our favorite go-to 
For lunch dinner or just a drink and appetizers
Delicious food - fresh and subtly seasoned. Perfect for end-of-week dinner at home. The bread is like pastry!

Changes absolutely not for the better. I hesitated to write this review as I've been to this restaurant at least half dozen times in the past and had always loved it.  While I understand that many restaurants have had to make some adjustments after surviving Covid, the adjustments that Storico has made as a total package no longer work: way too many tables now, the portion sizes have been so scaled down, and reservations appear to be meaningless. I never mind paying for a good dining experience, but don't expect to pay close to $500 and leave hungry.

1)  We had an 8:00 reservation and didn't get seated till 8:40...reservation appeared to be meaningless.
2)  The prepared food fridges have been replaced with way too many tables, many large communal tables, and no accounting for acoustics...the noise level is now deafening to the point of not being able to hold a comfortable conversation...even our order had to be repeated a few times for our server to get it right.
3) Biggest bone of contention is that the portion sizes have been so scaled down, even after appetizers, and entrees, our party of six had to order two more entrees... I'm sorry, but when you pay $26 for a basic pasta dish it should be a satisfying portion.  Added to this, we couldn't taste any difference between the sauces of Cavatelli with wild boar ragu' vs the Tagliatelli Bolognese...and both dishes were bland.

There is no bread service, unless you pay for it. I'm sorry, this is a pasta restaurant. Bread should be automatic, otherwise your entree actually costs $4 more. 

Sad that we will be hard pressed to return again.

The 4 star rating is for the food alone as it was delicious, but the portion sizes were very small. Per their rules section they do not adjust any of the ingredients that make up the menu items so it may be difficult to eat here if you have an allergy or a food intolerance. The venue was also very crowded as I went on a Saturday night and it was difficult to hear/ have a conversation.
The food, service and vibe is always great! I recommend going on a weeknight. One of my favorite Italian spots in buckhead

Start the review with the food being very good. Got Nebbiolo to go with two types of pasta and the meatball app which was good. DO NOT order the smoked old fashion- worst drink I've ever had. The smoke tasted like plastic and overwhelming. We were seated on the patio so far outside the restaurant could've ordered take out and eaten on the street.

Got a salad, rapini, chitarra arrabbiata and a spritz. I was fully expecting the pasta to be spicy but when it wasn't up to my heat level I had asked the waiter for additional peppers. To my GREAT surprise they brought me fresh red peppers and they were SO delicious. Honestly I was expecting the dried red pepper flakes but with the additional heat it really took this pasta over the edge of amazing. I am so happy I stopped by, service was lovely, people were friendly and I was in and out in no time.

Overpriced food at best ... not a large, varied menu of choices ... service was slow at 3:30 on a Saturday afternoon!  Ambiance wasn't anything special either.  We won't be patronizing this establishment anymore.

I enjoy real Italian cuisine. At least the type you get in New York City or Boston and Baltimore little Italy. The fragrance and the atmosphere. Is here! Come enjoy as my Family and I have. One of the best bartenders is a woman name Gia makes outstanding drinks to perfection.

My friends and I visited here on a weekday. It was busy, but had a great ambience.
The food was delicious! Tiramisu was so good we ordered another one!
However, the waitress was not very nice. Asking for information on a dish seemed to make her mad. We kept an ear out to how she spoke to other customers and she was the same way- rushed and not friendly. Bummer- overall great eating experience!

photos.caption: Polpo alla Griglia - squid ink pasta

comment.text: Made a reservation to come in with a friend last Friday at 5:45. Most definitely suggest making a res if you come on Friday or Saturday! They do have some outdoor seating, but we opted for inside. It's super cute and cozy. They do pack the tables in. Our waiter quickly came over to take our order. We both got the cacio e pepe. I also ordered a side of the mushrooms. The food came out pretty quickly! The cacio e pepe was absolutely perfect. Not too peppery (which is my fear with ordering this dish sometimes) and just enough cheesy. It wasn't a huge portion size if I'm being honest, but none the less tasty as heck. The mushrooms were also so delicious! I actually do suggest ordering them because they were that good! So flavorful and it comes with a ton of them! I brought half home. They do have a weekly pasta special. I've seen a few of them that look super tasty on their Instagram. Overall a good meal. A good spot for a date night or just a casual dinner with a friend!

Hidden gem on a side street w/ amazing Italian food! Drinks are pricey, but the pastas are fantastic. I was there on a busy Friday night, and the waitstaff still gave attentive, courteous service. Atmosphere was noisy but lively.

Romelo greeted us right away at our chefs table (mid kitchen amid the "hustle and bustle")  and took our drink order.... For Valentine's,  I had the passion of Santa Teresa, a light but potent cocktail.. J had the summer crush, which left him blushing...Charley, had the Mexican sprite (all the sprite but with cane sugar and not high fructose corn syrup)

Our antipasti (appetizer) was Fritto misto di Mare | 16
fried branzino (sea bass), shrimp & calamari 
It was amazing, light and crispy and so fresh...

Charley got the Salmone, pan-seared salmon, frisee, lentils, pistachio, mustard vinaigrette

J ordered one of the specials 
Linguine al' Aragosta | 29
linguine, half lobster, arrabbiata 

Me, I got the 12 hour bolonese marinated...
Tagliatelle alla Bolognese | 24
tagliatelle, beef, pork, veal ragu, grana padano

For dessert.... I had been dreaming of the burnt ricotta pie.....sweet dough, lightly sweetened ricotta, raspberry jam, honey and dusted with powdered sugar...

Charley got the Robiola cheesecake, creamy with a buckwheat lemon crust

J got the Tiramisu ...espresso soaked Savoiardi cookies, marsala, marscapone and dusted cocoa...

I, normally a chatterbox am left speechless....

What an amazing dining experience.....

Oh my gosh... never ceases to please the palate and the ambiance always has such great energy. My husband ordered  Cappeletti Spinaci and I had major dish envy!! It was phenomenal!!! My cacio e Pepe was also very good - rich but delicious! I always look forward to coming here when I'm in Atlanta.

photos.caption: Cappeletti Spinaci - THE DISH!!! Omg - so good!!

comment.text:
Great little Italian spot!  Service is good, restaurant is clean, food is excellent.  It is a very loud restaurant but it's got a cool open kitchen floor plan.  Stools were not the most comfortable for a sit down & enjoy your meal for awhile style of dining.  

Our table had the charcuterie board, it was ok, not too impressive although they do put honeycomb which I always think is fantastic on a board.  The wild boar pasta was excellent!  The fried chicken was very flavorful.  Others at our table had the bronzini and the lasagna, they both said it was excellent.  I'd definitely go there again!

Their bathroom sign is pretty funny!

I'm a FOREVER a customer! The food here is soooooo fresh and amazing. I love it so much I moved up the street, lol. No, but I was seriously excited to know this place was so close. I've become a fan of sitting at the bar because the bartenders and their service is nothing less than top tier. My last visit I had the fried chicken and OH EM GEE it was DIVINE. I've never had a more perfectly fried piece of chicken. I go here frequently for the Pepe though it's literally the best I've had. Yes, you would think it's a simple dish how can anyone mess it up but trust me, it happens but never at Storico Fresco, here it's always JUST RIGHT!

Cute Italian restaurant with outdoor heating.
Food was very good. And happy that the hostess was accommodating and found us a seat.  The only issue I has was how close we were to the other table during these Covid times.  At one point the chairs were up against each other and when we spoke up the staff separated the tables but this should be standard practice.  

Food review...
Brussel sprouts wit pine nuts- very tasty!
Fried rice balls- yum
The mushroom pasta dish is delicious!!!
Tagliatelle alla bolognese - good but I jazzed it up when I got home and made it amazing!

Really shocked by how rude the team member was on the phone! I called to inquire which fresh pastas they had available today. The team member was very unwilling to help and just kept repeating 'no'. To the point when I asked if she checked to see which pasta they had she simply said 'no'. I can't make this level of poor customer service up. It is honestly laughable. 

I've eaten here before and the food was just ok. This is not my first time having a negative customer experience here and this is enough to make me never go back. There are too many other restaurant options that have much better food and stellar hospitality.
Delicious fresh house made pasta. The bolognese was amazing. The gelato for dessert too. Great cocktails as well!
Fantastic food sat outside and it was perfect. The staff is friendly and the food didn't take long to revive.

We ordered carry-out for a celebratory dinner. Then food was made quickly (as in, we called to place an order, we drove over, and it was waiting for us)! Overall the pasta dishes (chitarra and cavatelli) had decent sauces that clung to the all dente pasta, and the Fritos misto had a light and well seasoned batter. Our only complaint is the price- for two entrees and an appetizer, we were paying almost $100

The pasta is fresh and the wine selection is superb. The octopus was perfectly cooked and paired so well with the navy beans. Best tiramisu I've ever had. Service was the only thing lacking. You can tell the staff works as a team and the place has stellar energy. But our food wasn't properly coursed and the wine service was sub par. Nothing a little training can't fix! 
Highly recommend

After seeing/hearing about this place on one of our favorite "instagram celebrity's" feeds for a long time, we finally made it over and gave it a try. It's hard to find parking here, so the valet parking may be the best option for you, especially if it is raining like it was for us.

Once inside, we seated and ordered some drinks and appetizers. We both ordered margaritas (though the light weight did look interesting) and a few appetizers, both of which were great. I wish they had brought four meatballs instead of three, as that's much easier for two people to split. The stuffed squash blossoms - real good, and they would be wise to make a dinner sized portion of this for people! My wife ha the tagliatelle alla bolognese, which was very tasty. I chose the Linguine al Pesto e Gamberi - pesto shrimp pasta. The shrimp were full sized. Not de-veigned or peeled, which was a bummer. It ruined what would have otherwise been a great meal. As it was, it was still a great meal, though I would probably choose something else the next time I eat here. The squid-ink pasta has caught me eye...

owner_replies.comment:
Hi Chip-

Thanks for the very kind review! We're glad you enjoyed everything. We hope to see you soon!

Amanda

comment.text:
What can I say about Storico that hasn't been said on this forum and everywhere else? It's simply MAGICAL.
My wife first visited this restaurant during the pandemic before we were married and while things were locked down in LA and we haven't stopped coming ever since.
Romulo greeted us with open arms as it was the first time we had dined INSIDE since the world closed down and we celebrated! We instantly hit it off and his knowledge coupled with warm and caring personally have made us MASSIVE fans. We travel to Atlanta roughly 4 times a year and have yet to go to the city WITHOUT stopping into Storico. There's something truly special about the food and culture there that you simply don't see in many places and for us it started with Romulo from Rio!
There's no bad seats in the house, from the chef's table to the bar, and everything in between your surrounded by authentic Italian cuisine and the freshest ingredients. Thanks again to our shepherd Romulo and the team, you guys truly have something special!

Solid enough Italian food in a hyper trendy spot in buckhead. Has a euro feel and the buzz is alive and well as you sit outside. Staff is bustling. The cocktails are great and can't go wrong with many of the apps. The suppli and pizzette were good. My steak was surprisingly good with oyster mushrooms and arugula for $26. The ravioli are homemade and so is much of the pasta so you're in for a treat. Sorry no pics.

My favorite restaurant in Atlanta!! Anytime we have friends or family in town, we take them to this restaurant and they love it just as much as we do. Its our go to date night spot as well. The ambience is great. They incorporate team based serving approaches. Their spinach and butter sage dish is my favorite, as well as their tiramisu! It's the go-to every time. They also have great bread service (bread does not come with pasta, it's a separate order). The menu is a little pricey but 100% worth the splurge. You won't be disappointed. I also recommend making a reservation, they usually always have an availability but you'll typically still end up waiting a few minutes for a table.
